intro: Cephaelis tabouensis, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in woodland and forest understory environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Cephaelis tabouensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
